CatDescriptText: Mr. Bill Neuuland, of Collins, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "In your opinion, what effect on the community do interracial churches have? Do you believe this type of membership should be encouraged?  Why?"  Answer reads: "It has a good effect...We're all working for one place... It promotes friendship for all."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bill Neuuland, wearing textured double breasted coat with collar, toggles, pockets, and tabs on cuffs, and eyeglasses, holding paper bag and case, standing on Liberty Avenue in front of windows with hanging wreaths and light colored curtain
